attributes.action: Free up our curriculum to teach more about global history, culture and societies
attributes.additional_details:
Instead of separating black history to one month why don't we just teach history from a global perspective. After all we don't do one month of European or Asian History. It's all intertwined. 

This is something that will benefit every child as having a greater conception of world history means we can learn lessons from it and see how it informs the present.
attributes.background:
London alone encompasses more than 270 nationalities and 300 languages yet we are teaching history from a very narrow perspective. 

This is no longer compatible with the diversity we have in our cities. What we need is a new approach that is more holistic.
